## Load libraries


::: {.cell hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_19ff3251481f5e1850cce22dae3944f5'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
ggplot2::theme_set(ggplot2::theme_minimal())
penguins <- na.omit(penguins)
```
:::


## `ggplot2`

Credit to [Alison Hill + Allison
Horst](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/articles/intro.html)


::: {.cell hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_285ec90db94172b12552ad30f9a96262'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
mass_flipper <- ggplot(data = penguins, 
                       aes(x = flipper_length_mm,
                           y = body_mass_g)) +
  geom_point(aes(color = species, 
                 shape = species),
             size = 3,
             alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("darkorange","purple","cyan4")) +
  labs(title = "Penguin size, Palmer Station LTER",
       subtitle = "Flipper length and body mass for Adelie, Chinstrap and Gentoo Penguins",
       x = "Flipper length (mm)",
       y = "Body mass (g)",
       color = "Penguin species",
       shape = "Penguin species") +
  theme(legend.position = c(0.2, 0.7),
        plot.title.position = "plot",
        plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0, face= "italic"),
        plot.caption.position = "plot",
        plot.background = element_rect(color = "black"))
```
````
:::


## Basic plot


::: {.cell hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_09874550c0e396adf73afb40df4c42a8'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
mass_flipper
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](plots_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=2100}
:::
:::


## Basic plot

Increasing the width/DPI only affects the scaling of the image, it will
not overflow.


::: {.cell hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_80c502a6a63e17e5eafb7a6a073262c1'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| fig-width: 10
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-dpi: 600
mass_flipper
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](plots_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=6000}
:::
:::


## Aside


::: {.cell fig-column='margin' hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_100b48bd19659bd6ee966864bffc0272'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](plots_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=2100}
:::
:::


> The palmerpenguins R package contains two datasets that we believe are
> a viable alternative to Anderson's Iris data (see datasets::iris). In
> this introductory vignette, we'll highlight some of the properties of
> these datasets that make them useful for statistics and data science
> education, as well as software documentation and testing.

## Overflow Content

There are many options for overflow, either left/right


::: {.cell .column-body-outset-right hash='plots_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_9ed22b63add4648330818c6522daaf87'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| column: body-outset-right
#| fig-width: 10
mass_flipper
```
````

:::
